events.title: Magna Carta
events.description: English charter limiting royal power. Established principles of due process and rule of law that would influence human rights development.
events.significance: Foundation of constitutional liberties and due process

events.title: Petition of Right
events.description: English constitutional document setting out specific liberties that the king could not infringe. Prohibited taxation without Parliament's consent and arbitrary imprisonment.

events.title: Habeas Corpus Act
events.description: English law requiring that a person under arrest be brought before a judge. Fundamental protection against arbitrary detention.
events.significance: Core procedural right against arbitrary detention

events.title: English Bill of Rights
events.description: Act of Parliament declaring the rights and liberties of subjects. Established parliamentary sovereignty and limited royal power.
events.significance: Foundation of constitutional monarchy and rights

events.title: US Declaration of Independence
events.description: Declared 'all men are created equal' with unalienable rights to 'life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness.' Based on natural law philosophy.
events.significance: Natural rights philosophy in founding document

events.title: Declaration of the Rights of Man
events.description: French Revolution document proclaiming universal rights including liberty, property, security, and resistance to oppression.
events.significance: Universal rights concept and citizen sovereignty

events.title: Slavery Abolition Act (UK)
events.description: British Parliament abolished slavery throughout the British Empire. Compensation paid to slave owners.
events.significance: Major step in abolition of slavery

events.title: First Geneva Convention
events.description: First international treaty for protection of wounded soldiers. Birth of international humanitarian law and the Red Cross movement.

events.title: First Hague Peace Conference
events.description: International conference establishing laws of war. Created Permanent Court of Arbitration.

events.title: ILO Established
events.description: International Labour Organization created as part of Treaty of Versailles. First specialized agency for workers' rights.

events.title: League of Nations Minorities System
events.description: First international system for minority protection through bilateral treaties. Applied mainly to new states in Central/Eastern Europe.

events.title: Slavery Convention
events.description: League of Nations convention to suppress slavery and slave trade. First universal anti-slavery treaty.

events.title: UN Charter Signed
events.description: Founding document of the United Nations. Article 1(3) establishes human rights promotion as a UN purpose. Article 55-56 create obligations.

events.title: Nuremberg Trials Begin
events.description: International Military Tribunal prosecuted Nazi leaders for crimes against humanity, war crimes, and crimes against peace.
events.significance: Individual criminal responsibility for international crimes

events.title: UN Commission on Human Rights
events.description: First UN body dedicated to human rights. Eleanor Roosevelt as first chair. Drafted UDHR.
events.significance: First dedicated UN human rights body

events.title: Genocide Convention
events.description: Convention on the Prevention and Punishment of the Crime of Genocide. First human rights treaty adopted by UN.

events.title: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
events.description: Adopted by UN General Assembly on December 10. 30 articles covering civil, political, economic, social and cultural rights. Non-binding but highly influential.
events.significance: Foundation of international human rights law

events.title: American Declaration of Rights
events.description: American Declaration of the Rights and Duties of Man. Adopted months before UDHR. First international human rights instrument.

events.title: Geneva Conventions (1949)
events.description: Four conventions forming core of international humanitarian law. Protection of wounded, POWs, and civilians in armed conflict.

events.title: ECHR Adopted
events.description: European Convention on Human Rights signed in Rome. First binding international human rights treaty with enforcement mechanism.

events.title: Refugee Convention
events.description: Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees. Defines refugee status and principle of non-refoulement.

events.title: ECHR Enters into Force
events.description: European Convention on Human Rights becomes binding law after ratification by 10 states.
events.significance: First operational human rights treaty system

events.title: European Social Charter
events.description: Council of Europe treaty on economic and social rights. Complements ECHR with ESC rights.
events.significance: European economic and social rights protection

events.title: ICERD Adopted
events.description: International Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination. First of the 9 core UN human rights treaties.
events.significance: First core UN human rights treaty

events.title: ICCPR & ICESCR Adopted
events.description: International Covenants on Civil and Political Rights and Economic, Social and Cultural Rights. Together with UDHR form the International Bill of Rights.

events.title: American Convention on Human Rights
events.description: Pact of San José. Main human rights treaty of the Inter-American system. Creates Inter-American Court.

events.title: ICCPR & ICESCR Enter into Force
events.description: Both International Covenants become binding after achieving required ratifications.

events.title: Inter-American Court Established
events.description: Inter-American Court of Human Rights begins operations in San José, Costa Rica.
events.significance: Regional human rights court for Americas

events.title: CEDAW Adopted
events.description: Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women. Often called international bill of rights for women.

events.title: African Charter Adopted
events.description: African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights (Banjul Charter). Unique in including peoples' rights and duties.

events.title: CAT Adopted
events.description: Convention against Torture and Other Cruel, Inhuman or Degrading Treatment or Punishment.

events.title: Declaration on Right to Development
events.description: UN Declaration on the Right to Development. Recognizes development as a human right.

events.title: CRC Adopted
events.description: Convention on the Rights of the Child. Most widely ratified human rights treaty. Only US and Somalia initially did not ratify.

events.title: Fall of Berlin Wall
events.description: End of Cold War division. Enabled expansion of human rights systems to Eastern Europe.
events.significance: End of Cold War, human rights expansion

events.title: ICRMW Adopted
events.description: International Convention on the Protection of the Rights of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families.

events.title: Paris Principles
events.description: Principles relating to the Status of National Institutions (Paris Principles). Standards for NHRIs.
events.significance: Standards for national human rights institutions

events.title: Vienna World Conference
events.description: World Conference on Human Rights. Reaffirmed universality. Created OHCHR position.

events.title: OHCHR Established
events.description: Office of the High Commissioner for Human Rights created. José Ayala-Lasso first High Commissioner.

events.title: ICTY Established
events.description: International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia. First international criminal tribunal since Nuremberg.

events.title: ICTR Established
events.description: International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda following genocide.

events.title: Beijing Women's Conference
events.description: Fourth World Conference on Women. Beijing Declaration and Platform for Action.

events.title: ECtHR Reformed (Protocol 11)
events.description: Protocol 11 creates permanent full-time European Court of Human Rights. Direct individual access.

events.title: Rome Statute Adopted
events.description: Statute of the International Criminal Court. Permanent court for genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes.

events.title: ICC Enters into Force
events.description: International Criminal Court becomes operational after 60 ratifications.

events.title: African Court Established
events.description: African Court on Human and Peoples' Rights begins operations in Arusha, Tanzania.

events.title: Responsibility to Protect
events.description: World Summit Outcome Document endorses R2P. States have responsibility to protect populations from atrocities.

events.title: Human Rights Council Created
events.description: UN Human Rights Council replaces Commission on Human Rights. Universal Periodic Review mechanism.

events.title: CRPD Adopted
events.description: Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Social model of disability. First treaty of 21st century.

events.title: ICPPED Adopted
events.description: International Convention for the Protection of All Persons from Enforced Disappearance.

events.title: First UPR Cycle Begins
events.description: Universal Periodic Review begins examining all 193 UN member states' human rights records.

events.title: UN Guiding Principles on Business
events.description: UN Guiding Principles on Business and Human Rights endorsed. Protect, Respect, Remedy framework.

events.title: OP-CRC-IC Enters into Force
events.description: Optional Protocol to CRC on communications procedure. Children can bring complaints to CRC Committee.

events.title: Sustainable Development Goals
events.description: 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development. 17 SDGs integrating human rights throughout.

events.title: Paris Climate Agreement
events.description: Paris Agreement on climate change. Preamble references human rights obligations.

events.title: Brighton Declaration
events.description: Declaration on reform of ECtHR. Emphasized subsidiarity and margin of appreciation.

events.title: Protocol 15 to ECHR
events.description: Adds subsidiarity and margin of appreciation to ECHR preamble. Reduces time limit to 4 months.

events.title: Lawless v. Ireland (ECtHR)
events.description: First case decided on merits by ECtHR. Concerned detention without trial during IRA emergency.

events.title: Golder v. UK (ECtHR)
events.description: Established right of access to court is implicit in Article 6. Prisoner correspondence rights.

events.title: Handyside v. UK (ECtHR)
events.description: Freedom of expression protects ideas that 'offend, shock or disturb.' Margin of appreciation doctrine.

events.title: Ireland v. UK (ECtHR)
events.description: Distinguished torture from inhuman/degrading treatment. Five techniques case.

events.title: Soering v. UK (ECtHR)
events.description: Extradition to face death row conditions would violate Article 3. Extraterritorial application.

events.title: Osman v. UK (ECtHR)
events.description: Positive obligation to protect life when authorities know of real and immediate risk.

events.title: Hirst v. UK (No. 2) (ECtHR)
events.description: Blanket ban on prisoner voting violates Protocol 1, Article 3. UK non-compliance controversy.
